meanings.definition: A woman who is the head of a family or tribe.
meanings.sent1: The matriarch of our family always makes sure everyone is taken care of.
meanings.sent2: The Native American tribe's matriarch led the community with wisdom and strength.
meanings.sent3: The matriarch of the family jokingly declared herself the queen of the household.
meanings.sent4: She stood tall like a matriarchal oak tree, providing shade and shelter to all around her.
meanings.sent5: The matriarch's presence in the room commanded respect and admiration from all.

meanings.definition: A woman who is a powerful or influential figure in a particular field.
meanings.sent1: As a matriarch in the business world, she paved the way for other women to succeed.
meanings.sent2: The fashion industry recognized her as a matriarch of style and innovation.
meanings.sent3: The matriarch of the art community was known for her bold and avant-garde creations.
meanings.sent4: Her words carried the weight of a matriarch, influencing decisions and shaping the future.
meanings.sent5: She was a matriarch in the world of science, breaking barriers and inspiring generations to come.
